sentences.en: A place of extreme wretchedness or squalor.
sentences.cn: 极端凄惨的地方或极度肮脏不堪的地方.

sentences.en: Despite its squalor , Trenchtown proved a fertile breeding ground for music.
sentences.cn: 然而,壕沟城贫民窟的脏乱穷困却成为音乐创作的肥沃土壤.

sentences.en: He was born in squalor next to London's docks.
sentences.cn: 他出生在伦敦码头附近肮脏的地区.

sentences.en: He was out of work and living in squalor.
I find public squalor very saddening.
sentences.cn: 公共场所的肮脏污秽让我感到非常悲哀。

sentences.en: It tells the story of an aspiring young man's attempt to rise above the squalor of the street.
sentences.cn: 它讲述了一位有志青年试图摆脱贫苦肮脏的街头生活。

sentences.en: It was a mixture of squalor and magnificence.
sentences.cn: 它是肮脏破旧和壮丽豪华的混合体.

sentences.en: Outside the walls, squalor and pollution abound in the streets.
sentences.cn: 围墙外, 肮脏和污染充斥大街.

sentences.en: Squalor and poverty lay behind the city's glittering facade.
sentences.cn: 这城市表面繁华,背后却肮脏和贫困.

sentences.en: the dehumanizing effects of poverty and squalor
sentences.cn: 贫穷和肮脏的环境造成丧失人性的结果

sentences.en: The miles of grey squalor she had travelled through were now the hazy and luminous city.
sentences.cn: 她走过的绵延几英里长的灰蒙蒙的肮脏的建筑物现在变成了一座朦胧中灯火辉煌的城市.

sentences.en: the poverty and squalor of the slums
They were forced to endure living conditions of unbelievable squalor.
sentences.cn: 他们被迫承受难以置信的贫困而肮脏的生活中.

sentences.en: We lived in squalor for a year and a half.
sentences.cn: 我们在肮脏的环境里住了一年半。

sentences.en: What troubled him was the squalor of [ the colonel's ] aesthetic ( Lewis H. Lapham )
sentences.cn: 使他苦恼的是 [ 上校 ] 审美观的低下刘易斯H. 拉伯姆 )

words.tran_cn: 肮脏；悲惨；卑劣；道德败坏

trans.tran_cn: 污秽，肮脏，悲惨，贫困，道德败坏
trans.tran_en: the condition of being dirty and unpleasant because of a lack of care or money
